body.name: XLR to XLR Cable 1 Feet, Premium XLR Microphone Cable, Heavy Duty 22AWG OFC XLR Male to Female Cord, 3-Pin Shielded Mic Speaker Cable, Zinc Alloy Connectors, Metal Spring SR, Black
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Monday, February 19 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 8 hrs 8 mins
features: 【Pro-grade Microphone Cable】: Kxable XLR cables feature high-quality 22AWG pure copper wire as the conductor, which is more sturdy and stable than 24/26AWG. Greatly improving the performance of cables. Provide you with a hearing feast with high fidelity sound, no noise and no electrostatic interference.

【Premium Material】: Our XLR to XLR cables use zinc alloy shell that is stronger than aluminum case, providing a more stable connection. Compared with ordinary jacket, our cable uses imported high-elastic pvc which provides stronger protection. The male plug adopts a self-locking connector design, which is easy to pull out, insert, and firmly lock. In addition, the end of the wire adopts a metal spring SR design, making it more flexible and durable, never breaking.

【Copper Braided Balanced Shielded】: Kxable microphone XLR cord has high density Copper Braided shielding and Al-foil shielding can greatly resist EMI/RFI and ensure Hi-Fi audio sound quality. Heavy duty Zinc Alloy Connectors for wireless mic sets. The included 5 cable ties help manage cables in an organized manner.

【Wide Application】: Our XLR cables compatible with equipment has 3-pin connectors. Such as microphone, harmonizer, podcast, digital audio mixer, patch bay, preamplifier, speaker, wireless mic, amplifier, recording studio and more. Great suitable for KTV, Stage Sound, Professional Sound Reinforcement.

【Worry-Free Service】: We offer a one-year warranty for these cables. If you have any questions, please contact us and our professional customer service will reply to you within 24 hours. Meet all your needs. Our cables have multi-pack options: 1-Pack, 2-Pack, 6-Pack, 10-Pack, 20-Pack, 50-Pack. Various XLR cord lengths: From 1ft to 200ft.
body.description: HI-FI Heavy-Duty XLR Cable Kxable XLR cable features 22AWG pure copper wire as the conductor, which greatly improves the performance of the conductor. Provide you with a hearing feast with high fidelity sound, no noise, high fidelity and no electrostatic interference. Kxable XLR cable uses zinc alloy shells, High-elastic pvc jacket and metal spring SR design (more flexible and durable, never rupture). Self-locking male to female connector design (easy to pull out, insert and firmly lock). These high-quality materials make this XLR cable has HI-FI sound quality and excellent texture.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars No issues with these XLR cables
reviews.reviewText: I am in a little local band and used these as an upgrade and replacement for some old and failing cables. They have worked great and I have had no issues with them for the few times we've used them so far. No complaints. I like the spring shielding on one of the ends.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Nice cabling and decent assembly, but with a wiring faux pas
reviews.reviewText: The Kxable mic cable is pretty good. The cable stock looks to be of good design. Double shielded, copper over foil, with additional strengthening fibers inside. The soldering skill is decent, with no cold or dirty joints. The cable assembler tied the XLR Shell to Pin1, which is generally a no-no for analog audio. XLR shells should almost always be floating relative to the cable, so that they may ground to the chassis at the device. In a "properly" designed device, either Pin1 and the shell will tie to chassis at the same point local to the connector, or the shell directly to chassis at the connector and Pin1 to a low-impedance bus bar and then to chassis. Unfortunately, many improperly designed devices will tie Pin1 to the circuit ground on the PCB, which then ties to chassis far away, often near the power input, injecting shield noise across the PCB. Having Pin1 tied to shell in a cable plugged into a device like that now means that there are multiple paths from circuit ground to chassis ground. The main time I can think where you might want shells terminated inside the cable is for digital cables that are intended to be daisy-chained. In that scenario, it creates a continuous shield around the "splice". You'll still need to be sure that the devices on both ends terminate Pin1 directly to the chassis as close to the connector as possible. It would be easy enough to just snip the connection inside the XLR connector, except on one of the connectors the assembler brought the shield conductor to the shell tab first, then to Pin1, so snipping it would lift Pin1 on that end, which depending on specific application you might want or not. Not a big deal, there's plenty of conductor length to desolder it from the tab and move it over.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great size for speaker jumpers.
reviews.reviewText: I needed some XLR cables to connect my subs and pole mounted main speakers. In most applications, 6 foot cables are about 9 inches too short. I would have preferred 7' cables, I don't like extra cable mess, but these are an acceptable compromise. Very well constructed, close to Mogami silver in quality. They will get a lot of use.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Great tension relief with the connections nice and beefy. Should have a long lifespan.
